title: A21 (low basic) Spanish Course
description:
#### Learning objectives

The objective of this course is to teach and provide the students with the necessary linguistic tools to be able to understand sentences and frequently used expressions related to areas of most immediate relevance (e.g. very basic personal and family information, shopping, local geography, employment);  to communicate in simple and routine tasks requiring a simple and direct exchange of information on familiar and routine matters; and describe, in simple terms, aspects of the past and the environment, as well as matters related to immediate needs.

**ORAL COMPREHENSION**
The student will be able to understand expressions and the most common vocabulary on topics of personal interest (e.g. very basic personal and family information, shopping, place of residence, employment), and the main idea of short, clear, simple messages and announcements.

**READING COMPREHENSION**
The student will be able to read very short, simple texts, find information such as advertisements, leaflets, menus and timetables, and understand short, simple personal letters.

**ORAL INTERACTION**
The student will be able to communicate in simple and routine tasks requiring a simple and direct exchange of information on familiar topics and activities; and maintain very brief social exchanges.

**ORAL EXPRESSION**
The student will be able to use a range of expressions and phrases to describe in simple terms their family and other people, their living conditions, their educational background and their present or last job.

**WRITTEN EXPRESSION**
The student will be able to write short, simple notes and messages relating to immediate needs, and write very simple personal letters, for example, to thank someone for something.
info_contact: cnotari@uji.es
prerequisites:
####  Basic/intermediate/advanced knowledge on a specific topic(s) or theme(s)

An A1 level in Spanish, or at least some previous knowledge, is necessary.

details:

This learning offer is mixed, which means there will be synchronous and asynchronous sessions. 
Please consider a work-load per week of: 9 hours (6 in class + 3 autonomous work)

The minimum technical requirements you need to participate are: computer with internet access, microphone and camera. Connections will be stablished through Meet, Zoom or Teams

#### Schedule/Timetable of the learning offer

Mondays, Wednesdays and Thursdays - from 16h to 18h

Number of hours: 45

Starting: 07/01/2025

End: 10/02/2025

Evaluation period: at the end of the course

title: Sprachcafé Deutsch als Fremdsprache (Winter 2024/25)
description:
#### Learning objectives
**NOTE: Language of this offer is GERMAN**

Language cafés are not structured language courses. Instead, they are an opportunity for an informal online exchange between students from different linguistic and cultural backgrounds. Hence, we ask that participants’ language level be at least a B1. 
Students who are passionate about languages have the opportunity to participate in this activity in their free time to chat about all things related to languages and cultures in a relaxed and casual environment. Tutors of native-speaker level will be there to co-ordinate the sessions. Participants are encouraged to actively contribute to the sessions and have their say in planning future topics and activities.


#### Details of the learning scenario

Café sessions last approximately one hour and take place regularly online during the University of Potsdam's lecture period (please see schedule details below). Please note that no ECTS points can be awarded for participating in the language café sessions. Students can join the language café via the Open.UP platform at any time during the semester. There is no application deadline. However, please note that slots for the language café sessions are subject to availability, as the number of places is limited.
The link to Open.UP, where EDUC students can register for the language café and set up their own account, can be found below. In addition, a Zoom account is required to participate online.
info_contact: educ-application@uni-potsdam.de
group_target: Bach. students year 1,Bach. students year 2,Bach. students year 3,Master students year 1,Master students year 2,PhD

title: German A1
description:
#### Learning objectives

The course is suitable for learners who have never studied German before and who need a rather flexible setting which they can adjust to their own needs and prospects. 
The course comprises learning material related to typical areas of communication and basic needs in a German speaking community. Learners can explore the material along the steps Understanding (units with language input along with reflexion exercises, explanations and learning videos), Training (mainly vocab and grammar exercises), Testing (quizzes about language use) and Broadening the perspective (additional material from the Zessko as well as the internet). To ensure learners can manage without a tutor, all exercises come with either computer feedback or an answer key.
Upon successfully engaging in this course, learners: 

- can recognise concrete information (e.g., places and times) on familiar topics encountered in everyday life, provided it is delivered slowly and clearly.
- can understand some expressions when people are discussing them: personal and academic life, hobbies or surroundings, provided the delivery is slow and clear.
- can understand instructions addressed carefully and slowly to them and follow short, simple directions.
- can understand very short, simple texts a single phrase at a time, picking up familiar names, words and basic phrases.
- can guess the probable meaning of an unknown word/sign that is similar to one in the language they normally use.
- can produce simple, mainly isolated phrases about people, time and places.
- can ask and answer simple questions, initiate and respond to simple statements in areas of immediate need or on very familiar topics.
- can make an introduction and use basic greeting and leave-taking expressions.
- can ask for food and drink using basic expressions.
- can handle numbers, quantities, cost and time.


(Can-Do statements according to the CEFR)
info_contact: educ-application@uni-potsdam.de

title: Communications Manager (France)
description:
**Duration of the internship**
5 - 6 months

**Hours per week**
To be decided

**Preferred start date**
From January 2025

*The organisation has indicated that the start and end dates are flexible.

**Further information about host organisation and relevant links**
BNP Paribas Group

**Description of the tasks**
In one of the entities of the BNP Paribas Group, you will join a team in charge of Communications. Our businesses share a culture of service and expertise. Our teams are driven by the desire to meet the challenges of our businesses on a daily basis, with a constant focus on quality of service. Your tasks will be cross-functional and you may be required to work in a number of different areas.
-Internal and/or external communication: proposing, designing and implementing communication media
-Events: helping to organise events
-Digital: creating and updating content on the intranet
 Depending on the BNP Paribas Group entity to which you are assigned, these tasks may change.


**Description of skills and competencies to be developed**
This internship will enable you to discover the BNP Paribas Group and enrich your knowledge and skills while completing your academic training. You will also develop your network by working with a wide range of contacts on a daily basis. 

**Host organisation support:**
A package and benefits : 
An attractive gross monthly bonus, above the statutory minimum,
Access to the company restaurant or luncheon vouchers,

**Host organisation support: mentoring conditions**
Our tutors undergo continuous training to provide you with the best possible support in every aspect of your placement, always in a caring manner. In fact, part of their working time is dedicated to supervising you: advice on working methods, help with time management, developing a professional attitude, etc. So you can feel good from the moment you arrive!


**Additional requirements**
You have a good command of MS Office.
You have knowledge of consulting, project management and change management.
In addition, your adaptability and your ability to collaborate and communicate both orally and in writing will be essential assets. Add to that a good sense of organisation, analysis and rigour, and we'll be convinced. You are results-oriented and have the ability to share and pass on knowledge.
In a changing world, diversity, fairness and inclusion are key values for the well-being and performance of our teams. At BNP Paribas, we want to welcome and retain all talents without distinction: this is how, together, we will build the innovative, responsible and sustainable finance of tomorrow.
 Finally, we attach particular importance to ensuring that our future employees act ethically and professionally on a daily basis.

**Application process**
If your CV is selected by our recruitment team, you will undergo online cognitive tests, followed by one or two interviews with operational managers. 

**Field of studies**
You are preparing a Master’s degree in business school, engineering or university equivalent with a specialisation in Digital Communications/Branding.

**Level of studies**
Master level 1
Master level 2
info_contact: Fill in the form below to express your interest and the relevant service from your university will get in contact with you.

title: Compliance Officer (France)
description:
**Duration of the internship**
5 - 6 months

**Hours per week**
To be decided

**Preferred start date**
From January 2025

*The organisation has indicated that the start and end dates are flexible.

**Further information about host organisation and relevant links**
BNP Paribas Group

**Description of the tasks**
The Compliance Function ensures that the Group is protected from any operations or processes that may contravene internal or external rules.
It also ensures the Group's security by adapting daily to the increased demands of regulators, customers and public opinion.
It is an international function that regulatory, geopolitical and societal developments are increasingly placing at the crossroads of the strategy and day-to-day activities of the bank and its customers.
The Compliance business lines are at the heart of BNP Paribas' strategic risk management. In an environment where regulatory, geopolitical and societal changes are increasingly numerous and complex, our specialists ensure compliance with all banking, financial and other regulations, thereby helping to ensure the Group's security.
During your immersion in the teams, you will be tackling one or more of these themes: 
Know Your Client (KYC)
Group Financial Security (GFS)
Protection of Customers' Interests (PIC)
Market Integrity (MI)
Professional Ethics (ET) 
Depending on the reception service within the BNP Paribas Group, these tasks may change. 

**Description of skills and competencies to be developed**
This course will give you a detailed insight into Compliance and you will have the opportunity to acquire :
A global and transversal vision of internal regulations and standards;
Cross-disciplinary knowledge of a variety of business lines and scopes;
Day-to-day contact with experienced Compliance Officers;
Intervene on a wide range of subjects.


**Host organisation support:**
A package and benefits : 
An attractive gross monthly bonus, higher than the statutory minimum; 
Access to the company restaurant or luncheon vouchers; 
Social and cultural activities via the works council.

**Host organisation support: mentoring conditions**
Our tutors undergo continuous training to provide you with the best possible support in every aspect of your placement, always in a caring manner. In fact, part of their working time is dedicated to supervising you: advice on working methods, help with time management, developing a professional attitude, etc. So you can feel good from the moment you arrive!

**Additional requirements**
You have an advanced level of English and are fluent in French. You have a good command of Microsoft Office tools, including Excel, Word and PowerPoint. You also have knowledge of compliance.
What's more, your adaptability and ability to collaborate and communicate both orally and in writing will be essential assets. Add to that organisational skills and an analytical mind, and we'll be convinced. 
Finally, we attach particular importance to ensuring that our future employees act ethically and professionally on a daily basis.


**Application process**
If your CV is selected by our recruitment team, you will take online tests, followed by one or two interviews with your tutor and future team.

**Field of studies**
You are preparing a Master’s degree at an engineering school, business school or university equivalent with a specialisation in Compliance and/or Law.

**Level of studies**
Master level 1
Master level 2

title: CSR (France)
description:
**Duration of the internship**
6 months

**Hours per week**
To be decided

**Preferred start date**
From January 2025

*The organisation has indicated that the start and end dates are flexible.

**Further information about host organisation and relevant links**
BNP Paribas

**Description of the tasks**
BNP Paribas places CSR (Corporate Social Responsibility) at the heart of its practices and aims to generate social and environmental value for all, in addition to economic performance.
Our teams are driven by the desire to meet the challenges of our businesses on a daily basis, with a constant focus on service quality.
As a CSR Project Manager, you will be involved in implementing the Sustainability/CSR culture within our operational processes and working environment.
 The main tasks will be :
∙ Data collection, analysis and processing (e.g. environmental indicators, monitoring, research)
∙ The development of tools
∙ Monitoring sustainable development action plans
∙ Identifying new areas for development in line with the company's CSR strategy
 Depending on the BNP Paribas Group entity to which you are assigned, these tasks may change.

**Description of skills and competencies to be developed**
This internship will enable you to discover the BNP Paribas Group and enrich your knowledge and skills while completing your academic training. You will also develop your network by working with a wide range of contacts on a daily basis. 
This course will enable you to enrich your knowledge and skills while complementing your academic training.
- Understand the strategic challenges associated with CSR 
- To develop the implementation of a corporate social responsibility policy;
- Interact cross-functionally with different departments and contacts at all hierarchical levels
- Find out how a large company operates
Through the diversity of your responsibilities/tasks and the contact with the professionals you will be working alongside, you will benefit from an ideal forum to discover how sustainable development fits into the company's project, its challenges and opportunities.

**Host organisation support:*
A package and benefits : 
An attractive gross monthly bonus, above the statutory minimum,
Access to the company restaurant or luncheon vouchers,

**Host organisation support: mentoring conditions**
Our tutors undergo continuous training to provide you with the best possible support in all aspects of your placement, always in a caring manner. In fact, part of their working time is dedicated to supervising you: advice on working methods, help with time management, developing a professional attitude, etc. So you can feel good from the moment you arrive!

**Additional requirements**
You will have knowledge of sustainable development and a keen interest in project management.
You have an advanced level of English and are proficient in MS Office.
In addition, your adaptability and your ability to collaborate and communicate both orally and in writing will be essential assets. Add to that organisational skills, an analytical and rigorous mind and a real ability to inspire others and generate commitment, and we'll be convinced. 
Finally, we attach particular importance to ensuring that our future employees act ethically and professionally on a daily basis. In a changing world, diversity, fairness and inclusion are key values for the well-being and performance of our teams. At BNP Paribas, we want to welcome and retain all talents without distinction: this is how, together, we will build the innovative, responsible and sustainable finance of tomorrow.
 Finally, we attach particular importance to ensuring that our future employees act ethically and professionally on a daily basis.

**Application process**
If your CV is selected by our recruitment team, you will undergo online cognitive tests, followed by one or two interviews with operational managers. 

**Field of studies**
You are preparing a Master’s degree from a business school, engineering school or university with a specialisation in CSR and/or sustainable development.

**Level of studies**
Master level 1
Master level 2

title: Corporate Customer Relationship Manager (France)
description:
**Duration of the internship**
4 to 6 months

**Hours per week**
To be decided

**Preferred start date**
From January 2025

*The organisation has indicated that the start and end dates are flexible.

**Further information about host organisation and relevant links**
BNP Paribas

**Description of the tasks**
You will support the Corporate Account Managers in managing and developing a portfolio of corporate customers, while ensuring quality of service and customer satisfaction. 
On a day-to-day basis, you will be in charge of customer contacts and enquiries.
You will implement remote banking services to ensure optimum customer satisfaction.  
To develop the business and its profitability, you will take part in canvassing activities with the Corporate Account Managers.
You will prepare client/prospect visits from a commercial, risk and profitability perspective.
You will help to identify commercial opportunities and formalise proposals.  
Working with the Corporate Account Manager, you will analyse the profitability of the business and identify areas for improvement. 
Working alongside the Corporate Account Managers, you will be involved in risk management, the study and implementation of financing and the annual renewal of the Fonds de Commerce's commitments, while ensuring that Compliance procedures are properly followed. 

**Host organisation support: logistic support**
 A package and benefits : 
An attractive gross monthly bonus, above the statutory minimum,
Access to the company restaurant or luncheon vouchers,

**Host organisation support: mentoring conditions**
Our tutors undergo continuous training to provide you with the best possible support in all aspects of your placement, always in a caring manner. In fact, part of their working time is dedicated to supervising you: advice on working methods, help with time management, developing a professional attitude, etc. So you can feel good from the moment you arrive! 

**Additional requirements**
Initial commercial experience in B-to-B and/or banking (internship or sandwich course) would be a plus.  
Initial experience in financial, legal or tax consultancy and a solid grounding in asset management would be a plus.
You speak fluent French, you have a good knowledge of financial analysis and you have a real commercial appetite, good communication skills and are a good listener.
In addition, your adaptability and your ability to collaborate and communicate both orally and in writing will be essential assets. Add to that a good sense of organisation, analysis and rigour, and we'll be convinced.

**Application process**
If your CV is selected by our recruitment team, you will undergo online cognitive tests, followed by one or two interviews with operational managers. 

**Field of studies**
You are preparing a Master’s degree at a business school, engineering or university with a specialisation in Banking, Finance or Risk Management. 

**Level of studies**
Master level 1
Master level 2

title: Data Scientist (France)
description:
**Duration of the internship**
6 months

**Hours per week**
To be decided

**Preferred start date**
From January 2025

*The organisation has indicated that the start and end dates are flexible.

**Further information about host organisation and relevant links**
BNP Paribas

**Description of the tasks**
Within our entities, you will contribute to the analysis of the needs of internal customers, by understanding their strategic and operational requirements, linked to the typology of data. You will then develop data collection principles and methods: data preparation and processing. You will then implement and adapt data analysis models and tools. Finally, you will be responsible for setting up dashboards or front-end portals for customers and managers.
You may also be asked to work occasionally on other subjects that are an integral part of our missions: high-stakes marketing approaches, campaigns and campaign ROI. 
Our tutors undergo continuous training to provide you with the best possible support in every aspect of your placement, always in a caring manner. In fact, part of their working time is dedicated to supervising you: advice on working methods, help with time management, developing a professional attitude, etc. So you can feel good from the moment you arrive!

**Description of skills and competencies to be developed**
This internship will give you the opportunity to find out more about the BNP Paribas Group, and enrich your knowledge and skills while completing your academic training. You will also be able to develop your network by working with a wide range of contacts on a daily basis.
Other opportunities may open up for you, helping you to enter the world of work:

**Host organisation support:**
A package and benefits : 
- An attractive gross monthly bonus, higher than the statutory minimum 
- Access to the company restaurant and/or luncheon vouchers, social and cultural activities via the works council, etc. 
- Depending on the environment, teleworking may be possible, to be organised with the tutor in accordance with company rules. 

**Additional requirements**
You have a good command of Pack Office, Python and Shell, as well as SQL, No-SQL and Data viz.
You have knowledge of Big Data, modelling and architecture.
Your adaptability and ability to collaborate and analyse will be essential assets. Add to that good organisational and communication skills, and you've got what it takes. 
 Finally, we attach particular importance to our future employees acting ethically and professionally on a daily basis.

**Application process**
If your CV is selected by our recruitment team, you will take online tests, followed by a maximum of one or two interviews with operational managers.

**Field of studies**
You are preparing a Master’s degree with a specialisation in Econometrics / Statistics / Big Data / AI / Applied Mathematics & Modelling.

**Level of studies**
Master level 1
Master level 2

title: HR Manager (France)
description:
**Duration of the internship**
4 to 6 months

**Hours per week**
To be decided

**Preferred start date**
From January 2025

*The organisation has indicated that the start and end dates are flexible.

**Further information about host organisation and relevant links**
BNP Paribas Group

**Description of the tasks**
The Group Human Resources department covers a range of activities. From Communications to the Employer Brand, from Recruitment to Contractualisation and Skills Development. 
Our teams are driven by the desire to meet the challenges of our businesses on a daily basis, with a constant focus on service quality.
As an HR Manager, you will be involved in a wide range of projects in line with the implementation of the Group's strategies. 
You will assist the department in its day-to-day activities: various HR management tasks in collaboration with cross-functional teams. 
You will contribute to communication initiatives and be a driving force behind any necessary process improvements.
Depending on the reception service within the BNP Paribas Group, these tasks may change. 

**Description of skills and competencies to be developed**
As a fully integrated member of the team, this position will provide you with ongoing exposure to the professional world, giving you the opportunity to discover the world of Human Resources and, more specifically, the world of recruitment, candidate relations and employer branding.
At the end of this experience, you will have acquired significant know-how and interpersonal skills. 
This course will enable you to enrich your knowledge and skills while complementing your academic training:
Understand the strategic challenges of recruitment and employer branding 
Developing your customer focus ;
Contribute to the deployment of the company's HR strategy;
Interact cross-functionally with different departments and contacts at all hierarchical levels;
Find out how a large company operates.

**Host organisation support:**
A package and benefits : 
An attractive gross monthly bonus, higher than the statutory minimum; 
Access to the company restaurant or luncheon vouchers; 
Social and cultural activities via the works council.

**Host organisation support: mentoring conditions**
Our tutors undergo continuous training to provide you with the best possible support in every aspect of your placement, always in a caring manner. Part of their working time is dedicated to providing you with guidance: advice on working methods, help with time management, developing a professional attitude, etc. So you can feel good from the moment you arrive!

**Additional requirements**
You have an advanced level of English and are fluent in French. You have an aptitude for digital culture and knowledge of Human Resources.
In addition, your adaptability, your ability to collaborate and communicate both orally and in writing will be essential assets. Add to that organisational skills and an analytical mind, and we'll be convinced. 
Finally, we attach particular importance to ensuring that our future employees act ethically and professionally on a daily basis.

**Application process**
If your CV is selected by our recruitment team, you will take online tests, followed by one or two interviews with your tutor and future team.

**Field of studies**

**Description of the tasks**
Management controllers ensure that BNP Paribas makes sound financial decisions. From modelling revenue trends to tracking performance metrics, your work will contribute to the Group's strategic decision-making. Working on multiple projects at the same time, you'll focus on the details while being creative to meet large-scale challenges.
Thanks to your analytical and financial knowledge, you will act as a link between the Finance team and the various business lines it supports. You will be able to synthesise and present your analyses clearly.
From the development of forward-looking analyses to the production of management reports and the implementation of automated financial processes, our teams are an important partner and advisor to the Group.
Your tasks will be as follows:
∙ Contributing to the organisation and running of monthly, quarterly and annual budget processes
∙ Prepare and manage financial reports (tracking actual, estimated and forecast) for business line managers
∙ Querying databases to design metrics, analyse trends and influence management decision-making

title: Research Internship - AI4Space: Exploring Space Radiation Effects on Artificial Intelligence Hardware (France)
description:
**Duration of the internship**
3 to 6 months

**Hours per week**
24 to 35 hours

**Preferred start date**
No constraints 

**Preferred end date**
No constraints 

**Further information about host organisation and relevant links**
The International Affairs Department of the University of Rennes is made of an international team of 23 administrative staff. The Department is located in a modern and central building in the city of Rennes. Rennes is the capital city of the Brittany Region, in the west part of France. Just 1.5h by train from Paris and 1h from the seaside. Rennes is a vibrant city, with plenty of sports and cultural activities to do.

**Description of the tasks**

**Context**: Nowadays, Artificial intelligence (AI) algorithms can accurately perform many tasks, such as language processing, image and video classification, audio and radar processing, and instance segmentation [1 - 3]. Recently, large AI applications such as OpenAI GPT-4, Meta LLaMA3, and Mistral Mixture of Experts have captivated public interest with their high accuracy. Those applications demonstrated a high accuracy not only in one specific task but also performed well when processing multimodal data (e.g., a combination of text and images). Recent AI algorithms have also shown outstanding performance in space exploration, as they can process data locally in the satellites and send only useful information to Earth, avoiding unnecessary communication [4, 5]. 

Due to their resource-intensive nature, AI programs need dedicated hardware accelerators, such as graphics and tensor processing units, to be employed in any application, including space satellites. Unfortunately, the hardware resources necessary to execute current state-of-the-art AI software are highly vulnerable to radiation-induced errors present on space missions. The errors caused by ionizing particles in space can modify the hardware operations and propagate through the software, leading to failures in AI systems. 

This research aims to characterize the error rate of AI codes for space exploration. We plan to characterize the impact of faults on AI algorithms with fault injection and propose efficient fault tolerance methods.  

**Work proposal**: The student will conduct fault simulation on AI-based systems to simulate faults caused by space radiation. The experiments will be conducted on a Microchip PolarFire System on Chip development board, with various AI algorithms in operation. Following the simulations, we will assess how the faults affect the operating system and the AI algorithms. We can then propose algorithm-level fault tolerance to mitigate system failures resulting from radiation-induced faults. Depending on the project schedule and progress, we may be able to perform accelerated radiation experiments to evaluate the error rate and fault tolerance. 

Required skills: 
- Advanced Computer architecture knowledge 
- C/C++ programming 
- Python Programming 
- Advanced knowledge of embedded systems 
- Basics of AI and machine learning 
- Knowledge of hardware description languages is a plus. 

*References* : 

[1] Xiaohua  Zhai et al., Scaling Vision Transformers, IEEE/CVF CVPR, 2022 
[2] Chong Chen, et al., Compound fault diagnosis for industrial robots based on dual-transformer networks, Journal of Manufacturing Systems, 2023 
[3] Yuxin Fang, et al., EVA-02: A Visual Representation for Neon Genesis, CVPR 2023 
[4] Jakubik, J. et al., HLS Foundantion, https://github.com/nasa-impact/hls-foundation-os 
[5] M. McCaskey, et al., Machine Learning Applied to an RF Communication Channel, NAECON 2018 

**Description of skills and competencies to be developed**
Ability to analyse and synthesise 
Problem solving 
Teamwork 
Critical and self-critical abilities
Ability to work in an international context 
Ability to learn 
Ability to apply knowledge in practice 
Concern for quality 

**Host organisation support: logistic support**
https://cmi.univ-rennes.fr/en/housing

**Host organisation support: financial support**
Allowance of €4.35 per hour

**Host organisation support: mentoring conditions**
One or more meetings per week with supervisors, based on the trainee's needs.

**Additional requirements**
None

**Application process**
Not listed

**Field of studies**
- Applied science  /  Engineering and technology 

- Formal science  /  Computer science 

**Level of studies**
Master level 1
Master level 2

title: Research Internship - Impact of bacterial motility on the accumulation of biosurfactants at air-water interfaces (France)
description:
**Duration of the internship**
5 to 6 months

**Hours per week**
35 hours

**Preferred start date**
03 February 2025 (flexible)

**Preferred end date**
07 July 2025 (flexible)

**Further information about host organisation and relevant links**
Webpage of senior supervisor: https://ipr.univ-rennes.fr/interlocuteurs/francois-peaudecerf

**Description of the tasks**

Evaporation from bare soils is a key hydrological process which returns a fifth of terrestrial precipitations directly to the atmosphere. This macroscopic phenomenon is governed at the microscale by capillary flows along water films between the top of the soil and the water at depth. The stability of these films is crucial to have an effective drying and it is highly sensitive to the physico-chemistry of the soil such as the surface tension at air-water interfaces or the contact angle of the aqueous phase with grains [1].  

In soil, bacteria abound, with ~ 1010 bacteria per gram of top soil. Many of them release surface active components – surfactants – in their surroundings which can strongly decrease the surface tension at air-water interfaces and change the contact angle [2]. To date, however, little is known about the potential impact of these bacteria on drying dynamics. How do surfactants accumulate at drying interfaces? Does bacterial behavior, in particular motility by swimming, modify this accumulation dynamics? What are the consequences on the interface behavior inside the soil pores? 

We started investigating these questions at the level of the single pore with the PhD project of Nathan Chapelle. We have already started developing an original experimental setup to follow the deformation of a single air-water interface which is put under evaporative forcing in the presence of surfactants, and validated our choice of model bacteria, B.subtilis. The goal of this internship is to get familiar with this setup and to shed light on the role of different bacteria phenotypes (in particular motile vs non-motile) on the repartition of bacteria and surfactants in the bulk and at this air-water interface. To do so, the intern will use microfluidic chips to mimic one pore of the soil, with an air-water interface present. Using optical microscopy techniques, he will track individual bacteria and characterize their behavior during evaporation from the interface. These results will be linked to changes in interface dynamics.  

The intern will be trained in and perform microfabrication by photolithography for microfluidics, microscopic imaging and image processing, particule tracking algorithms to follow individual bacteria as well as standard microbiological culture techniques. 

*References*: 

[1] D. Or and al., "Advances in Soil Evaporation Physics - A Review," Vadose Zone Journal, 12(4) 2013. 
[2] J Q Yang et al., "Evidence for biosurfactant-induced flow in corners and bacterial spreading in unsaturated porous media," PNAS, 118(38), 2021. 

**Description of skills and competencies to be developed**
- Elementary computer skills (data analysis with Python or equivalent software, image analysis with ImageJ) 
- Oral communication in English (potential presentation in seminars) 
- Written communication in English (writing an internship report) 
- Autonomy on an experimental setup 
- Initiative to deal with experimental issues 
- Ability in organising and planning experiments along the week 
- Teamwork 

**Host organisation support: logistic support**
https://cmi.univ-rennes.fr/en/housing

**Host organisation support: financial support**
Allowance of €4.35 per hour

**Host organisation support: mentoring conditions**
At least 1 meeting per week with the 2 supervisors.
The Institute has a thriving and enthusiastic community of graduate students, doctoral students and post-doctoral researchers in which the candidate would be included. The Soft Matter department also organises an interns-days where all research interns of the department share their project with others before a festive lunch. Finally, there are also several staff at the Institute available to provide support on technical issues, fabrication of experimental apparatus, and safety measures

**Additional requirements**
None

**Application process**
Not listed

**Field of studies**
- Applied science  /  Engineering and technology 

- Applied science  /  Environmental studies  

- Natural science  /  Biology 

- Natural science  /  Physics 

**Level of studies**
Master level 1
Master level 2

title: Luxury: Social Psychological Approaches for Professionals  (2024-2025)
description:
#### Learning objectives

The main objective of the course Luxury: social psychological approaches for professionals is to make students familiar with a social psychological perspective on the interactions in the world of luxury.
 
The course addresses the social psychological interactions and processes that underlie the world of luxury, as well as professional contexts in luxury businesses such as hotels, resorts, restaurants, the fashion world, make-up universes, etc. 

First, the course provides students with the social psychological keys to understand and contextualise the ways in which people think, feel, and behave in relation to luxury. 
 
Secondly, the course considers the contemporary stakes in the luxury world - for example, environmental concerns, as well as interactional stakes between luxury professionals and clients. 
 
Thirdly, the course equips students with the knowledge and tools to better understand the functioning of small groups, which are often created in luxury businesses: group affiliation and membership in work teams, leadership and its relation to group performance and group climate, norm formation, conformity, obedience, social influence, and social change, etc.
 
In addition, the course contributes to the development of students’ soft skills, such as active listening, leadership, conflict management, group work, cross-cultural interactional skills.

title: European Law : Politics of the EU (2024-2025)
description:
#### Learning objectives

**This course will give an overview of several fields of competences of the European Union.**

It will aim at offering a better comprehension of the concrete actions carried out by the EU.

After describing the political finality and the specificity of the original community project, it will analyze the different scope of competencies of the EU, illustrating the hybrid nature of the EU, as a mix of supranational and intergovernmental organization.

The selected topics will highlight the three different types of competences of the EU (exclusive/shared/supporting competences): 

-**Internal market**

-**Economic and monetary union**

By covering economic as well as political tasks of the EU, the course will reexamine the role and the results of the method of European integration commonly known as **"spillover effect"** or ** "functionalism"**.
